reviews.text: Staff were really friendly and helpful. Toilets easily accessible and the platforms are tidy and clean. The free wifi is helpful with good bandwidth and range. There are frequent trains into London Marylebone and surrounding areas and platforms and trains not too overcrowded. Loving the Union Jack bunting too ;-)

Chinnor & Princes Risborough Heritage Railway will be opening Platform 4 and running Steam and Diesel trains into the platform for the first time in 61 years from August 15th 2018.  It will be possible to catch a train from Marylebone, London or Birmingham and change at Risborough and ride to Chinnor on a Heritage Train, inclusive tickets available from National Rail stations too.
small indoor waiting area. plenty of parking
Ticket office isn't open long enough. Has peak hours cafe and newsagent. The level of comfort could be improved.
A lovely junction railway station, soon interchange with steam trains on the Chinnor & Princes Risborough Railway will be possible.
